data.description: About our group: The Head Disk Mechanical Team integrates heads and media for developing the next generation Seagate perpendicular magnetic recording (PMR) and Heat Assisted Magnetic Recording (HAMR) products. We work with Seagate design centers and component centers around the world to stage novel head disc media interfacial technologies to improve the tribological performance, areal density, and reliability of PMR and HAMR Hard Disc Drives (HDDs).About the role - you will: Integrate novel head and media technologies to improve the tribology of PMR and HAMR head disk interfaces Characterize Transducer and Media technologies to integrate in state of art hard drives Characterize the Head Disk Spacing and improve the test process to reduce head disk spacing sigma Perform a variety of experiments in the lab using bench instruments, signal processing, and oscilloscopes Do Volume data analysis using Python, JMP, Matlab, Minitab and MS Excel About you: Uphold key Seagate values of integrity, inclusion, and innovation. Excellent Communication and Teamwork abilities. Ability to communicate and collaborate with global and cross functional teams Highly motivated and self-directed Basic computer & presentation skills. Hands-on problem solver who can manage multiple projects. Adapt to rapidly evolving technology and work effectively with ambiguity and change. Your experience includes: Familiar with basic data analysis, running experiments, operating laboratory instruments, and preparing technical reports. Programming and debugging experience. You may also have: MATLAB or Python experience is a plus Competency in MS office applications. Experience with statistical analysis Experience with tribology, lubrication, contamination control, material characterization (AFM, SEM), and thin films is a plus Education: PhD or master’s degree in mechanical or electrical engineering, Physics, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering or equivalent and must be enrolled in Fall 2026 classes. Location: Our Normandale campus spans two suburbs, Edina and Bloomington, and serves as the Recording Head development and manufacturing arm of Seagate. Located in the heart of a bustling community, Seagate offers an on-site café, or if you prefer, you can drive to one of many restaurants just minutes away. Need to grab a gift over lunch time? Shopping is abundant in the area. If working out is your thing, the on-site fully equipped fitness center hosts wellness programs, outdoor activities, tournaments and group workouts. Looking for something more laid back? Reset in one of our meditation rooms, or simply take a walk around our indoor walking path. On-site cultural festivals, celebrations and community volunteer opportunities also abound. #internship The estimated base wage range for this position is $22-$43/hr. The individual base wage is based on work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Seagate offers comprehensive benefits to its eligible Interns, including, but not limited to, medical, dental, vision, and participation in the employee stock purchase plan. Seagate also offers Interns 12 paid holidays and a minimum of 48 hours of paid sick leave. The benefits for this position are based on a 24 to 40-hour-per-week schedule for a full calendar year and may differ depending on work location and tenure with the Company Location: Normandale, United States Travel: None
